task_description: Facing the building to your East (approx. 99°), estimate the height of the main building in front of you in meters. Answer with one number and a short rationale.

reason: I need to see the full façade and roofline of the east-facing building to estimate its total height, so I should tilt upward first.
The prompt specifies the target building is to the East (~99°), but I’m currently facing North, so I should rotate right to align with East while keeping the elevated pitch to see the roofline.
I’m aligned with the east-facing building; now I should estimate its height by typical floor-to-floor scale and visible stories, so I can stop with a best estimate.
